remarks: Fundamental theorem of arithmetic, where a prime factorization is represented as a finite monotonic 1-based sequence of primes.  Every positive integer has a unique prime factorization.  This is Metamath 100 proof #80.  (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Nov-2012.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 30-May-2014.)
